In order to celebrate a culture of reading during March is Reading Month, Lake Shore High School teachers are reading a page out of the book Inch and Miles: The Journey to Success by Coach John Wooden. Mrs. Meldrum added with the reminder that eating good food, thinking good thoughts, and getting plenty of rest are important parts of success, too! Examples have been uploaded to the Shorian Report Video Production's YouTube channel at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCk1K2YbOTerCXOvvN-gVa5Q.Subscribe to listen to examples like https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttKWcoJAhCI and https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7CjuuuWxh1I.

The Masonic Heights 2nd grade team presented Penny Sauve, Director of Grosse Pointe Animal Adoption Society (GPAAS), with a check for over $415. Students raised all of their money on their own through Market Day projects.

Market Day gave students the opportunity to run a business with real expenses. Once a business idea was brainstormed, students needed to choose a product to sell. In this case, they were encouraged to sell at least 20 handmade paper products. Allowing for production time, working out any kinks, and developing marketing techniques was an important part of the process! These 2nd graders made paper airplanes, custom holiday trinkets, bookmarks, rockets, and turtles with painted shells. Rebecca Parrinello sold bobble animals. She was especially excited about this donation to GPAAS because she loves caring for animals! In fact, Rebecca has two turtles, one dog, and one lizard.

Thank you to every customer who brought their shopping bags and money to help these entrepreneurs be profitable!

Lake Shore Public Schools staff continues to use Professional Development days as an important time to strengthen our skills as professionals and adapt to the ever changing learning, cultural, and social-emotional needs of our children. From the most effective and innovative instructional strategies to school safety and student well-being matters, investing this time on February 18th and future calendar dates is a key to the on-going high level of success for our students.

Our entire 520 Lake Shore Public Schools staff met yesterday to continue to build lessons and get professional development training to serve our students. For example, our 4th grade teachers visited the Macomb County Animal Shelter to network with the staff in the hope of raising awareness about animals in shelters. Inspired by reading Winn-Dixie, this team of dedicated teachers will be asking their students to create a media campaign, which is just one of many requests from the MCAS's Wishlist, to launch prior to May 9th, their next Adoption Day. How exciting!

Fourth grade students at Masonic Heights Elementary demonstrated their knowledge of formulating scientific arguments by presenting to family, peers, and teachers at the Science Fair. They began with a probing question, created a material list, designed a procedure, and through fact finding, came up with results. The unique topics ranged from the best method of cleaning pennies, using potatoes to power battery chargers, plus slime and rock candy experiments.

Mr. Faught's AP Biology students assisted with these student-led projects on Tuesday, February 4th by assisting with scientific questions, facts, hypothesis, materials, and procedures. They also helped to analyze the data and results of investigations and written conclusions. Students recorded their investigation using Google Slides, too!
